intro: Tylophora luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon Tylophora, is a climbing vine native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Tylophora luzonica is often found in lowland and montane forests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
